description: Showy milkweed (Asclepias speciosa) is an amazing plant species with extraordinary characteristics. Its silky, fragrant, oval-shaped flowers flaunt an array of vibrant colors like pink, yellow, and white, which attract pollinators like butterflies, moths, and bees. Its leaves and stems are filled with a white sap which is poisonous to many animals and will produce a slight rash on those sensitive to it. The plant is also a food source for monarch butterflies, animals such as deer, elk, and antelope, and other wildlife. Showy milkweed is truly a remarkable plant that beautifies many landscapes and helps sustain its local ecosystems.
